intro: Ononis barbata, commonly known as sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 centimeters. The plant features hairy stems and leaves that are divided into lobes, often with a distinctive barbed appearance. Its flowers are small, yellowish-green, and clustered in umbels, blooming from spring to summer. Sandspurry thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas or along roadsides.
